intro: Hemithrinax savannarum, commonly known as the savanna palm, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and a crown of pinnate leaves that are often used for thatching. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, which are followed by orange-red fruits containing a single seed. Hemithrinax savannarum thrives in dry, open habitats such as savannas and coastal dunes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
